intro: Zosterella dubia, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a rare and enigmatic species of aquatic plant. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent leaves that resemble ghostly apparitions, giving it its common name. This plant is typically found in shallow, still waters with soft, muddy substrates. Zosterella dubia is a member of the Zosteraceae family, which includes other aquatic grasses. Its botanical structure consists of long, ribbon-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often submerged.
